text: Angus Daniel McDonald (April 14, 1878 – November 15, 1941) an American railroad executive. He was president of the Southern Pacific Company, the parent company of the Southern Pacific Railroad. McDonald attended the University of Notre Dame, where he was the first baseman and team captain for the baseball team, and both the quarterback and placekicker for the football team in 1899. McDonald was the first kicker at the university to use a holder (a technique known then as the "Princeton Kick") rather than the drop kick. In 1931, McDonald was named a Knight of Malta by Pope Pius XI. ==References== * * Category:American railroad executives of the 20th century Category:Southern Pacific Railroad people Category:American football quarterbacks Category:Notre Dame Fighting Irish football players Category:1878 births Category:1941 deaths
title: Angus Daniel McDonald
